Who?: I am not quite sure if we can meet your requirements.
누구?: 우리가 당신의 요구를 충족시켜 드릴 수 있을지 모르겠네요.

Who?: I don't have much money, but I can get along somehow.
누구?: 나는 돈이 별로 없지만, 그럭저럭 지낼 수 있다

Who?: Weather permitting, we'll start on our trip tomorrow.
누구?: 날씨가 허락한다면, 우리는 내일 여행을 시작할 것이다.

Who?: Her dress attracted everyone's attention at the party.
누구?: 그 여자가 파티에 입고 온 드레스가 사람들의 눈길을 끌었지.

Who?: Please come here between two and three this afternoon.
누구?: 오늘 오후 두시에서 세시 사이에 여기로 와 주세요.

Who?: What's the difference between religion and philosophy?

누구?: 늦는 것이 안 하는 것보다 낫지요.
지금 나와 이야기 할 수 있어요?
그것에 대해서 왈가왈부 할 필요가 없지요.

Who?: Do you have everything with you?
How many times do I have to say?
I am fed up with this.
I am going to miss you.
I can not handle it anymore.
누구?: 난 더 이상 다룰 수 가 없어요.
전 그것을 감당 할 수 없어요.
너무 감사해서 뭐라고 할 말이 없네요.

Who?: I have got to go now.
I have a long way to go.
I hear you loud and clear.
I will do it for you.
I will never make it on time.
In a sense, he is nothing but a suit.
Keep an eye on this, will you?

누구?: 그것에 대해서 좀 생각 해 봅시다.

Who?: Let's give him a big hand.
Let's go over it one more time.
That's all there is to it.
Things will work out all right.
This is just between you and me.
To the best of my knowledge.
We are in the same boat.
What do you think of it?
Why didn't I think of that?
You went too far this time.
I've heard a lot about you.
I've been wanting to meet you for along time.
How're you getting along these days?
I hope it's OK with you.
I hope you can make it.
누구?: 네가 그것을 만들 수 있으면 좋겠다.

Who?: I hope my plane leaves on time.
누구?: 내가 탈 비행기가 제시간에 출발 했으면 좋겠다.

Who?: Can I give you a hand?
Guess what I just found out.

누구?: 넌 이걸 믿을 수 없을 거야.

Who?: There is something I want to talk to you about.
May I have a word with you?
누구?: 너랑 얘기 좀 할 수 있어?

Who?: May I ask you a question?
Is this your first time here?
I came here once with a friend.
누구?: 이전에 한 번 친구와 온 적이 있습니다.
